ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: In the past 7 days, please describe how often people in your life... I felt mad.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: In the past 7 days, please describe how often people in your life... I was so angry I felt like yelling at somebody.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: In the past 7 days, please describe how often people in your life... When I got mad, I stayed mad.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often

Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: In the past 7 days, please describe how often people in your life... I was so angry I felt like throwing something.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: In the past 7 days, please describe how often people in your life... I felt upset.
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often
